name: The Times and The Sunday Times

episodes.title: Legal Expert Explains What Could Happen Next To Andrew
episodes.description:
“They may call him back for further interview, under arrest or not, at any stage.”

Wendy Fraser KC, a former judge at the Old Bailey, outlines the process of a police investigation and what could happen next as Thames Valley Police confirm Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been released under investigation.

Wendy Fraser was speaking to Chloe Tilley and Guto Harri on Times Radio Breakfast. Listen live everyday, 6-10am.

episodes.title: Epstein Scandal Fallout Hits Countries Like UK Harder Than US | Andrea Shalal
episodes.description:
“Here in the United States… the epicentre of it, we’ve seen very little in terms of consequences.”

The Epstein scandal is having a global impact, with figures such as Mandelson having to step down, but the consequences are seemingly less severe in the US, says White House Correspondent at Reuters Andrea Shalal.

Andrea Shalal was speaking to Calum Macdonald on Times Radio Breakfast. Listen live everyday weekend from 6-10am.

episodes.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Requests A Pardon From Trump In Return For Information | David Charter
episodes.description:
“Maxwell’s lawyers said she would speak freely with Congress, provided she was given a pardon.”

During a congressional interview, Ghislaine Maxwell appealed directly to President Trump for a pardon as her lawyers said she could explain why Trump is “completely innocent,” says assistant US editor for The Times, David Charter.

David Charter was speaking to Kait Borsay on Times Radio Evening Edition. Listen live every Monday to Thursday 7-10pm.

episodes.title: Starmer's Future is Inevitable: 'It Is Over, He Is Finished' | Patrick Maguire
episodes.description:
"The buck stops with the prime minster not having thought hard about the politics of the situation or indeed politics at all."

Starmer's sealed his own fate because he is "insufficiently political" and outsourced all his decisions even "against [his] better judgement", says The Times's Patrick Maguire.

Patrick Maguire and Patrick English were speaking to Ed Vaizey on Times. Listen live everyday from 10am -1pm.

episodes.title: High-Profile Figures Resign In Epstein Fallout, But Shouldn’t Be 'Guilty by Association' | US Lawyer
episodes.description:
“I’m a little appalled at the guilt by association.”

“You’re innocent until proven guilty” and people are being socially or professionally punished simply because they knew or were connected to Jeffrey Epstein, defence attorney Cathy Fleming says she has "some trouble with."

Cathy Fleming was speaking to Jane Garvey and Fi Glover on Times Radio. Listen live Mon-Thurs from 2pm-4pm.

episodes.title: Epstein Files Explained: Trump, Gates, Andrew and the Documents
episodes.description:
Millions of documents linked to Jeffrey Epstein have been released in an unprecedented data dump, revealing new details about his network and its reach. The files include emails, flight logs and financial records involving some of the world’s most powerful figures. But many claims remain unverified, raising urgent questions about truth, accountability and harm.

#epsteinfiles #explained

episodes.title: How Epstein Threatened A Journalist And Carried On Abusing
episodes.description:
“I was furious for myself. I was very, very worried and frightened for the Farmer sisters.”

Journalist Vicky Ward shares her experience of intimidation by Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein after the Farmer sisters’ allegations were cut from a Vanity Fair article in the early 2000s.

Vicky Ward was speaking to Jane Garvey and Fi Glover. Listen live to Jane and Fi every Monday-Thursday on Times Radio from 2pm-4pm.

episodes.title: Epstein Files Show How Powerful Men Protect Each Other | Helen Rumbelow
episodes.description:
“This is actually a deeper and darker and more profound revelation of how very powerful men use their networks with each other, which are drenched in misogyny, to hold on and help each other stay in control.”

After sifting through millions of newly released Epstein files, Times columnist Helen Rumbelow argues the story is being misframed as the downfall of a few high-profile men, rather than a deeper exposure of how power operates behind closed doors, as the documents reveal a network of powerful men bound by misogyny, mutual protection, and the routine dehumanisation of women.

Helen Rumbelow was speaking to Hugo Rifkind on Times Radio. Listen live Mon-Thurs from 10am-1pm.

episodes.title: Epstein Was 'Effectively Involved In Russian Organised Crime' | Christopher Steele
episodes.description:
“They’ve tracked Epstein’s activities and operations back to the 1970s.”

Former head of MI6’s Russia desk, Christopher Steele, says it appears to him that, as early as the 1970s, Epstein was “effectively involved in Russian organised crime.”

Christopher Steele was speaking Kate McCann and Stig Abell on Times Radio Breakfast. Listen live every day 6-10am.

episodes.title: Peter Mandelson Allegations ‘Biggest Scandal Since Profumo Affair’
episodes.description:
“On the face of it, it looks like one of the biggest crises, scandals about standards in public life, since Profumo.”

The Times's Patrick Maguire says it’s difficult to convey “the level of shock, dismay and anger” about the allegations that Peter Mandelson leaked insider information.

Patrick Maguire and Rosamund Urwin were speaking to Hugo Rifkind on Times Radio. Listen live Monday-Thursday, 6-10am.

episodes.title: Mandelson A ‘Person Of Interest’ In Epstein Investigation, Says Congressman | Suhas Subramanyam
episodes.description:
“Certainly he’s a person of interest.” 

Congressman Suhas Subramanyam says Lord Mandelson “seems to have a lot of information that’s important to the public.” 

Suhas Subramanyam was speaking to John Pienaar on Times Radio. Listen live everyday from 4-7pm.

episodes.title: Epstein Files: Andrew Invited the Paedophile Financier to Buckingham Palace
episodes.description:
“In Andrew’s case, it adds to all the suspicions about him.”

Newly released Epstein files suggests that, after the convicted paedophile financier was released in 2010, his friendship with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor re-emerged and seemed to be “stronger than ever”, says royal correspondent Rupert Bell.

Rupert Bell was speaking to Chloe Tilley and Calum Macdonald on Times Radio. Listen every Friday to Sunday 6-10am.

episodes.title: Epstein Files: ‘Disturbing Allegations’ About Trump Surface As More Pages Are Released
episodes.description:
“It’s an incredibly dangerous allegation.”

Journalists are “racing” to comb through newly released Epstein files that mention Donald Trump hundreds of times, including an accusation of rape of a then-13 year old, reports Sarah Baxter.

Sarah Baxter was speaking to Cathy Newman. Listen live to Times Radio Drive with Cathy Newman every Friday from 4pm - 7pm.

episodes.title: Neo-Nazi that posed "immense threat" jailed for six years
episodes.description:
A neo-Nazi was jailed for six years after encouraging young girls to commit suicide online. 

Cameron Finnigan was also caught in possession of extreme right-wing material. Counter Terror police described Finnigan as an "immense threat" to the public.
